channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: The First Fully Digital, NFT Artwork is Headed to Auction
item.description: NFT couldn’t ask for a more legitimizing momentWhile NFTs can arguably be traced back to 2012, they didn’t hit the mainstream until 2017 with blockchain-based CryptoKitties. Check out our NFT FAQ here.  On the auction block: A digital collage of the first 5,000 other-worldy images from Beeple’s “everyday” series, in which Winkelmann has created a new piece of digital art every day for over 10 years. It will be the first fully digital, NFT-based artwork ever sold by a major auction house, and the first to accept cryptocurrency (Ether, specifically) as a payment option. Last December, a collection of 20 Beeple pieces sold for $3.5 million on another NFT platform, Nifty Gateway.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: February 25
item.description: Quote: “This is not ideal for us and it’s not a new normal. Read: The secret message NASA sent to Mars, and the people who decoded it. Texas’s move to deregulate power generation is being blamed for last week’s electricity crisis.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: First Covax Delivery Touches Down in Accra, Ghana
item.description: Funded by donations, it hopes to vaccinate 20% of people in the world’s 92 poorest countries by the end of the year. Yesterday, Ghana became the first country to receive a vaccine care package from the UN-backed Covax program.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Biden Addresses Global Semiconductor Chip Shortage With Executive Order
item.description: Though the trip was a success, it exposed just how fragile the US public health supply chain is.  Bottom line: Biden’s executive order hopes to eventually reduce the US’ reliance on other countries across a wide swath of essential industries.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Brew's Bookshelf: 15 Books for Black History Month
item.description: Conversations in Black: On Power, Politics, and Leadership by Ed Gordon Imagine a roundtable discussion asking big questions about the future of Black leadership and navigating a divided country. Kendi A collection of essays from prominent Black scholars, journalists, and leaders examining different periods of Black history since the first slave ships arrived in the US in 1619. Journalist Ed Gordon brings that to life with curated answers from prominent Black politicians, activists, and leaders.  The Color of Money: Black Banks and the Racial Wealth Gap by Mehrsa BaradaranTo understand the racial wealth gap, first you have to understand the segregated economy it was built on and the history of Black banks and ownership.  Black Futures by Jenna Wortham and Kimberly DrewA 544-page anthology of art, essays, stories, recipes, memes, and more from Black creators around the world examining what it means to be "black and alive right now." Franchise: The Golden Arches in Black America by Marcia Chatelain What does McDonald's mean to the civil rights movement? Learn something new about the history of Black America, its impact on culture, business, and science, and ponder the question of "what's next?"
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Morning Brew Style Blog, No. 8: How to Kill Your Darlings
item.description: Maybe that reads a little blunt.  Then, you can go through the process described in No. 1; if the draft you write to your college roommate Dan feels too casual, you can zhuzh it up. That’s why editors are essential And I’m not just saying that because it’s review season and my editor decides whether I get a raise. Your best editor can be (and often is) a friend or family member—often, the person who’s most brutally honest about your outfits is your best editor. The magic of a good editor is that she can filter all the unneeded stuff gumming up your sentences without compromising your voice. If you feel it’s too much, you can add back a few fluffy descriptors, or maybe even Jeffrey’s name. And because we love making things way more morbid than they need to be, news folks call the process of removing excess verbiage “killing your darlings,” and sometimes even—sorry—“killing babies.”
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Fans Return to NYC's Basketball Arenas
item.description: Zoom out: The Knicks and Nets make it 14 NBA teams (out of 30) that are allowing fans to attend games. The backstory: NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo has allowed attendance at arenas provided that fans show a negative PCR Covid-19 test 72 hours before the event starts.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: What Is Market Capitalization?
item.description: Worth noting: Market cap =/= how much it costs to buy a company.  Ask us something else here.  Tesla is the leading EV producer, and legacy automakers and EV startups are largely playing catch up. Brew's answer: Market capitalization, aka "market cap," is a measure of a public company's worth based on the dollar value of outstanding shares.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: February 24
item.description: Yesterday, the Swedish vegan milk company Oatly filed confidentially for an IPO, and it's aiming for a valuation of up to $10 billion. Here's 1 quote, 1 stat, and 1 long read that we discovered yesterday and had to share. Read: On creativity and TikTok. (Eugene Wei)
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Lucid Motors SPAC Falls 39% on News of Deal
item.description: Lucid will raise $4.4 billion through the CCIV deal and use that money to help fund production and expansion into new vehicle lines. On Monday evening, electric automaker Lucid Motors confirmed it's going public via SPAC at a valuation of $24 billion.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: US Home Prices Spiked in December
item.description: Zoom out: A mix of historically low interest rates, the pandemic pushing people out of small apartments, and an inventory squeeze have juiced prices to unaffordable levels for many potential homebuyers.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Should You Be Worried About Inflation? Short Answer: Probably Not
item.description: Zoom out: Indicators of inflation usually show up in the job market; when it overheats, inflation can start to snowball.    Tech shares in the US and Europe have slumped in anticipation of potential interest rate hikes, a move central banks might make to keep inflation at bay. But many economists say there's no need to worry Including the ones who actually oversee the economy. But the current job market is like the frozen burrito you threw in the microwave—hot on the surface (high yearly wage growth), but icy at the core (elevated unemployment claims).
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: February 24
item.description: Read: On creativity and TikTok. (Eugene Wei) Yesterday, the Swedish vegan milk company Oatly filed confidentially for an IPO, and it's aiming for a valuation of up to $10 billion.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Fans Return to NYC's Basketball Arenas
item.description: Zoom out: The Knicks and Nets make it 14 NBA teams (out of 30) that are allowing fans to attend games.  Across the East River, the Brooklyn Nets also welcomed fans back to the Barclays Center.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: US Home Prices Spiked in December
item.description: Zoom out: A mix of historically low interest rates, the pandemic pushing people out of small apartments, and an inventory squeeze have juiced prices to unaffordable levels for many potential homebuyers.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: What is Market Capitalization?
item.description: Ask us something else here. Worth noting: Market cap =/= how much it costs to buy a company. Brew's answer: Market capitalization, aka "market cap," is a measure of a public company's worth based on the dollar value of outstanding shares.  Even though Tesla only recently became profitable and has had numerous issues meeting production schedules, investors believe that the EV market is going to explode.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Should You Be Worried About Inflation? Short Answer: Probably Not
item.description: Zoom out: Indicators of inflation usually show up in the job market; when it overheats, inflation can start to snowball.   But the current job market is like the frozen burrito you threw in the microwave—overheated on the surface (high yearly wage growth), but icy at the core (elevated unemployment claims). These soothing words helped stocks mount their big comeback yesterday.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Lucid Motors SPAC Falls 39% on News of Deal
item.description: Lucid will raise $4.4 billion through the CCIV deal and use that money to help fund production and expansion into new vehicle lines. On Monday evening, electric automaker Lucid Motors confirmed it's going public via SPAC at a valuation of $24 billion.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: LVMH Buys 50% Stake in Jay-Z's Champagne Brand
item.description: Yesterday, business mogul and rapper Jay-Z sold a 50% stake in his champagne brand, Armand de Brignac, to the wine and spirits division of luxury conglomerate LVMH.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: February 23
item.description: (The New Yorker)   Read: We're living in an age of peak advice. That's a 50% increase from 2019.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Cherokee Nation Requests That Jeep Drop Cherokee Name
item.description: the US auto industry has a long history of using Native American monikers and imagery.  Chief Chuck Hoskin Jr. requested that Jeep stop using his tribe's name on its Cherokee and Grand Cherokee SUVs, which together account for more than 40% of the brand's total sales.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Trump Taxes: Supreme Court Allows Manhattan DA to Subpoena Financial Documents
item.description: Yesterday, the nation's highest court blocked former President Trump from keeping his financial records out of the hands of Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. The details of Vance's investigation into alleged tax, insurance, and bank fraud by the Trump Organization (which includes residential and commercial real estate businesses) haven't been made public.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Spotify Joins the Rest of the Media World in Focusing on International Expansion
item.description: Netflix has invested in international content to differentiate itself in the streaming wars, maintain an upward growth trajectory, and serve something fresh to its American viewers.  Businesses are looking for new eyes and earsSpotify, which has headquarters in Sweden and the US, joins American media companies in recalibrating growth plans to place a larger emphasis on international markets.  "All this untapped music energy and access to our innovative creator tools will help propel artists to new heights," Spotify wrote in a statement. Put another way, a more global user base will help New Music Friday surface the Lupins of the music world.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Spotify Joins the Rest of the Media World in Focusing on International Expansion
item.description: Netflix has invested in international content to differentiate itself in the streaming wars, maintain an upward growth trajectory, and serve something fresh to its American viewers. Put another way, a more global user base will help New Music Friday surface the Lupins of the music world.  Big picture: With Hollywood and NYC churning out cultural hit after cultural hit, the US has historically dominated the music and entertainment industries.  "All this untapped music energy and access to our innovative creator tools will help propel artists to new heights," Spotify wrote in a statement.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: LVMH Buys 50% Stake in Jay-Z's Champagne Brand

item.title: The Week Ahead: February 22
item.description: Let us know if you've got any fun costumes planned. On Thursday, Airbnb and DoorDash will deliver their first earnings reports since going public. Chag sameach to our Jewish readers celebrating Purim Thursday night.  Warren Buffett will release his famous annual shareholder letter on Saturday.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Coinbase, Stripe Valued Above $100B
item.description: As the first US-based crypto exchange to go public, it'll also confer major legitimacy to digital currencies.  First up, CoinbaseAhead of its planned direct listing, investors are valuing Coinbase at $100+ billion, which would make it the biggest US tech listing since Facebook, per Axios.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: February 22
item.description: (New York Times) Read: A financial crisis is heading for the legendary soccer club, Barcelona. For once, though, his tweets went ignored: Both cryptocurrencies hit record highs this weekend.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Some Texans Face Exorbitant Electricity Bills Following Energy Crisis
item.description: Many Texans facing exorbitant charges were customers of power supplier Griddy, whose prices fluctuate with the wholesale energy market.   And Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner said the state of Texas should "bear the responsibility" of paying the egregiously high bills.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Economic Data Points to Positive Economic Recovery
item.description: The growing signs for optimismWhen investors are nervous about what's ahead, they typically buy US Treasury bonds, which sends bond prices higher and yields down.  Still, the latest wave of economic data has some experts hoping that the US is not only on the rebound, but ahead of schedule. Retail sales jumped 5.3% in January, aided by the latest round of stimulus checks. And when he testifies to the Senate and House finance committees this week, Fed Chair Jerome Powell is expected to continue pressing for more action.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: It is Snowing in Hawaii
item.description: 🤙  + Of course they have: Some locals have swapped their surfboards to snowboards to shred what they’re calling “pineapple powder.”
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Roku Breaks Records In Its Q4 Earnings Report
item.description: As people filled their 2020 voids with CW dramas, Roku’s users streamed 10% more per day in the fourth quarter of 2020 than they did in Q4 2019. It’s now on the lookout for more content to acquire, or even create some original programming of its own.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Covid Vaccine Tracker
item.description: One dose to rule them all: A peer-reviewed study conducted in Israel found that Pfizer’s vaccine is at least 85% effective after the first of two doses. 6.47 million doses are being administered daily, on average. 193 million doses have been administered in 87 different countries.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Marriott CEO Arne Sorenson Passes Away
item.description: The $42 billion company he leaves behind will name a successor by the end of the month.  During his tenure, Marriott's stock rose over 240%. Sorenson also used his position to speak out on issues around immigration and LGBTQ discrimination.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Snowstorm Unexpectedly Freezes Some US Businesses
item.description: A fearsome storm continued to roll through the south and central US yesterday, leaving millions of households without power in bone-chilling temperatures. Some authorities in Texas had to rush doses into people’s arms before they spoiled.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: WTO Appoints Ngozi Okonjo-Iwealea as Director-General
item.description: Yesterday, she was selected as the new WTO director-general. the WTO needs its court running. Okonjo-Iweala wants to reform the WTO to win back respect, promote fair trade, and help with the pandemic recovery. When she starts her 4.5-year term at the WTO next month, she'll be the first woman, African, and (a dual citizen since 2019) American to head the organization.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Mother Nature Unleashes Texas-Sized Storm on the South
item.description: And as huge as Texas is, this storm is bigger than just one state. A winter storm is pummeling the South, leaving millions without power and causing mayhem in the energy market. Texas is a powerhouse for fossil fuels, not renewable energy." But wind power is actually the fastest-growing source of energy in the state's power grid. 3+ million barrels/day in output have been taken offline, more than half of the 5.8 million barrels/day typically produced in the Permian region of Texas and New Mexico.
item.author: Neal Freyman
